segments.text: I'm absolutely fuming watching this entire spectacle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can anyone be so utterly oblivious to their surroundings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is everywhere, streaming onto the floor like a small river.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That woman is just standing there, polishing a plate, completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's infuriating to see such blatant negligence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those kids, climbing on that rickety stool, about to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Don't they understand the danger they're in?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to do something, this is just a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is going to be ruined by that water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to yell at them, to snap them out of it!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's making my blood boil, this combination of obliviousness and recklessness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Even the tidy garden outside can't calm my nerves about this mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is just so frustrating to witness.
segments.speaker: PAR
